173.article_body: Ramesh Powar, coach of India women's cricket team, revealed the reason for dropping opening batter Shafali Verma in the World Cup match against New Zealand on Thursday. Powar said that Verma was "given a break since the opener was out of form". Left-handed batter Yastika Bhatia replaced her in the match, which India lost by 62 runs.

174.title: Direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3: Biden
174.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday said that "direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3". [It's] something we must strive to prevent," he added. "We'll defend every single inch of NATO territory. We'll not fight a war against Russia in Ukraine," said Biden. "Putin's war against Ukraine will never be a victory," he stated.

175.title: Russian shelling killed at least 1,582 in Ukraine's Mariupol: Report
175.article_body: City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Friday said at least 1,582 civilians were killed due to Russian shelling and a blockade which lasted for 12 days. This comes as several civilian facilities including a children's hospital were destroyed by Russian forces in Mariupol since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

176.title: Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of Punjab's people: Kejriwal
176.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that he's sure that Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of the people of Punjab as the CM of the state. Notably, Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann met Kejriwal in Delhi today, a day after AAP won Assembly elections in Punjab. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

177.title: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang says he will step down next March
177.article_body: China's Premier Li Keqiang on Friday said that he plans to step down after his current term expires next March. Li is number two in the hierarchy of ruling Communist Party's Politburo Standing Committee. Reportedly, President Xi Jinping is expected to secure a precedent-breaking third term as party chief at a party meeting to elect leaders for next five years.

178.title: Can't wait for tomorrow: Kohli shares net session pics ahead of 2nd Test
178.article_body: Ahead of India's second and final Test against Sri Lanka, Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share a few pictures from his practice session in Bengaluru. "Back to Bengaluru. Can't wait for tomorrow," he captioned the pictures. The ex-India captain recently played in his 100th Test in Mohali. He has scored 8,007 runs in Tests so far.

179.title: SP leader Yogesh Verma who guarded EVM room using binoculars loses
179.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Yogesh Verma, who was seen guarding an EVM room using binoculars, lost on Thursday from Hastinapur in UP. The seat was won by BJP's Dinesh by 7,312 votes. Notably, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had levelled EVM tampering allegations and even said the machines were being transported without informing candidates. SP bagged 111 out of 403 Assembly seats.

180.title: Turkey moves its embassy from Kyiv to Chernivtsi: State media
180.article_body: Turkish Foreign Ministry spokesperson Tanju Bilgiç on Friday said Turkey has moved its embassy from Ukrainian capital Kyiv to Chernivtsi amid reports of a planned attack on the capital city by the Russian forces, reported state media. A country sharing maritime borders with Russia as well as Ukraine, Turkey was among the last countries to operate diplomatic missions in Ukraine.

181.title: US bans import of Russian vodka, seafood & diamond; downgrades Russia's trade status
181.article_body: US President Joe Biden announced on Friday that along with the European Union and the Group of Seven countries, the US will move to revoke "most favoured nation" trade status for Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. "We're also taking further steps, banning imports of goods from several signature sectors of Russian economy, including seafood, vodka and diamonds," he added.

182.title: Aaron Finch joins his 9th IPL team, replaces KKR's ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales
182.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has become the first cricketer to have been part of nine IPL teams. The 35-year-old has joined KKR for ₹1.5 crore as a replacement for their ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales, who has withdrawn from IPL 2022 due to bubble fatigue. Finch has played for RR, DC, PWI, SRH, MI, GL, PBKS and RCB in IPL.

183.title: Ukraine urges Israel to send military weapons and sanction Russia
183.article_body: Ukrainian ambassador to Israel, Yevgen Korniychuk on Friday urged Israel's government to enhance its support for Ukraine by sanctioning Russia and sending defence equipment. "What we expect from Israel at the moment... is to join the sanctions of their allies, including but not only the US and EU," he added. Kornyichuk also urged Israel to accept more refugees without limitations.

184.title: Plant 75 trees in each village to mark 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav': PM
184.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said that each village should create a small forest by planting 75 trees during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75 years of India's Independence. There should be at least 75 farmers in each village who adopt natural way of farming, he added. PM Modi made the comments during his address at Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan in Ahmedabad.

185.title: Pakistan inducts made-in-China J-10C fighter jets to counter India's Rafale jets
185.article_body: Pakistan has formally inducted China-made multirole J-10C fighter jets into its air force. "Unfortunately, efforts are being made to create an imbalance in the region and to address this, a big addition has been made today to our defence system," Imran Khan said. Last year, Pakistan's Interior Minister said the jets were acquired to "counter India's purchase of Rafale aircraft".

186.title: Russian forces have caused $100 billion in damage so far: Ukrainian official
186.article_body: The invading Russian forces have so far cost damage of at least $100 billion to infrastructure and other physical assets, said Oleg Ustenko, economic advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He added that the war has caused 50% of Ukrainian businesses to shut down completely, while the other half are operating well below their capacity.

187.title: 25-year-old man dies of alleged drug overdose in Punjab's Bathinda
187.article_body: A 25-year-old man died of an alleged drug overdose in Punjab’s Bathinda on Friday. The victim who worked in Rajasthan had allegedly arranged the drugs after returning to his village on Thursday, according to a Bhartiya Kisan Union-Ugrahan leader. The drug availability "is a serious challenge before the AAP government," the leader added while demanding immediate steps to control it.

188.title: Malinga named RR's fast bowling coach, Paddy Upton returns as 'Team Catalyst'
188.article_body: RR have appointed Lasith Malinga as their fast bowling coach ahead of IPL 2022. Malinga, who retired as a player in 2021, is the highest wicket-taker in IPL. "It's a wonderful feeling for me to return to IPL and an absolute honour to join RR," Malinga said. Further, Paddy Upton, who has worked for RR before, returns as 'Team Catalyst'.

189.title: 3 dead, 2 injured after truck hits parked vehicles on MP highway
189.article_body: Three people were killed and two injured after a truck collided with two parked vehicles, a tanker and a pick-up van, on Rewa-Prayagraj National Highway in Madhya Pradesh on Friday. The victims were pulled out of the vehicles with help of locals, police said. The injured were rushed to a hospital, while the bodies were sent for post-mortem, police added.

190.title: Jussie Smollett given 150 days in jail over staged hate crime case
190.article_body: Actor Jussie Smollett, who portrayed Jamal Lyon in drama series 'Empire', has been sentenced to 150 days in jail for staging a hate crime. Jussie had alleged that he was attacked by two men who yelled racist and homophobic slurs at him. He has also been ordered to pay $120,106 (₹91 lakh) in restitution and a $25,000 (₹19 lakh) fine.

191.title: Man hangs himself in TN after wife breaks phone suspecting affair
191.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after his wife broke his mobile while accusing him of having an affair with a woman. His wife, who had returned after spending six months at her native place, found him constantly messaging and speaking on phone, which led to an altercation, police said. She later found him hanging from ceiling.

192.title: Japanese schools ban ponytails fearing they might 'sexually excite' boys
192.article_body: Japanese schools have banned female students from wearing their hair in ponytails because the nape of their necks could "sexually excite" male students. "They are worried boys will look at girls," said a former middle school teacher. This is the same reasoning applied by schools while enforcing the white-only underwear rule for students, the ex-teacher said.

193.title: Singer Millind Gaba to marry longtime girlfriend on April 16
193.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend of four years social media influencer Pria Beniwal on April 16. The festivities will begin on April 11 with the couple's sagan ceremony. The wedding is expected to be a traditional ceremony with Punjabi rituals along with  Haryanvi Jat rituals.

194.title: When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things: GT's Gurkeerat
194.article_body: On getting opportunity to play for Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, batter Gurkeerat Mann said he's excited as the franchise showed faith in him. "When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things," he added. Gurkeerat was picked by Gujarat Titans for ₹50 lakh in mega auction 2022. He last played an IPL game in 2020 edition.

195.title: 27% winning candidates in Uttarakhand declared criminal cases: ADR
195.article_body: As per a report published by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR), 27% of the 70 winning candidates in Uttarakhand Assembly polls have declared criminal cases against themselves. The report said 14% of winning candidates have declared serious criminal cases against themselves. Five of the 47 winning BJP candidates have reported serious criminal cases against themselves, the report showed.

196.title: Attack on Saudi oil refinery, Yemen's Houthis claim responsibility
196.article_body: Saudi Energy Ministry on Friday said an oil refinery in capital Riyadh was attacked by a drone on Thursday early morning causing no injuries. "The refinery's operations and supplies of petroleum and its derivatives were not affected," added the ministry. Meanwhile, Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for the attack. Three dones were fired at the oil refinery, Houthi spokesperson said.

197.title: My mom tried to leave Kyiv but decided to stay back & help: Dar Gai
197.article_body: Ukrainian filmmaker Dar Gai has said her mother had tried to leave Kyiv at one point but decided to stay back and help volunteers amid the Russian invasion. She added her uncle is also helping people in bomb shelters. "The war in Ukraine has been happening for the last eight years but now people are talking about it," she said.

198.title: Over 2.5 million people fled Ukraine since Russian invasion began: UN
198.article_body: UN's International Organization for Migration (IOM) on Friday said over 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since Russian invasion began on February 24. IOM spokesperson Paul Dillon said while over 1.5 million refugees escaped to Poland, the rest were third-country nationals. Meanwhile, UN said that it verified 516 civilian deaths and 908 injuries since the conflict started.

199.title: Putin fires 8 generals, is furious over losses in war: Report
199.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has sacked 8 generals and is furious at his intelligence officials over Moscow's losses in war, Ukraine's Defence Secretary Oleksiy Danilov claimed. He was quoted as saying by a Ukrainian newspaper that Russia has changed its tactics. The Russians never thought that Ukraine "is so united", said Danilov, adding that the road ahead "won't be easy".

200.title: Impossible for Congress to survive without Gandhis: DK Shivakumar
200.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Friday said it is impossible for Congress to stay united and survive without the Gandhi family. "They are key for the unity of the Congress party," he said. He made the remarks after Congress lost all five Assembly polls, triggering conversations about an introspection. "We...will always stand with the Gandhi family," he added.

201.title: What are chemical weapons that US fears Russia will use against Ukraine?
201.article_body: US has warned Russia may use chemical weapons against Ukraine. They are chemicals used to cause intentional death or harm through toxic properties, Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons stated. Munitions, devices and equipment designed to weaponise toxic chemicals are also chemical weapons. Type of chemical agents include choking agents, blister agents, blood agents, nerve agents.

202.title: I'll be 100% there: Warner on attending Shane Warne's state funeral
202.article_body: Australia opener David Warner said he'll be 100% there for legendary spinner Shane Warne's state funeral, set to take place on March 30th at Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). "It [news] still hasn't really sunk in. When we first found out, we thought it was a joke," he added. "It's definitely going to be extremely emotional for everyone," he further said.

203.title: Pregnant woman accused by Russia of faking injuries in Ukraine gives birth
203.article_body: A Ukrainian beauty blogger who was accused on Twitter by the Russian Embassy in the UK of faking her injuries after their bomb hit a maternity hospital has now given birth to a girl. Marianna Podgurskaya was pictured heavily pregnant with injuries to her face as she walked down a staircase while holding her belongings. Twitter had deleted Russia's tweets

204.title: BJP's victory is not a true reflection of people's mandate: Mamata
204.article_body: After BJP won Assembly polls in four states, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said the BJP's victory is not a true reflection of people's mandate. She said that if Congress wants then all anti-BJP parties can fight together in the 2024 General Elections. "Don't be aggressive for now, be positive...This winning will be a big loss for BJP," she added.

205.title: Court orders 'The Kashmir Files' not to show scenes on late squadron leader
205.article_body: A Jammu district court has passed an interim order restraining the makers of 'The Kashmir Files' from showing scenes depicting late Squadron Leader Ravi Khanna in the movie. This comes after his wife filed a suit alleging that the scenes showing him are factually incorrect and demeaning. The Vivek Agnihotri directorial is set to be released on March 11.

206.title: Byju Raveendran invests $400 million in BYJU'S as it raises $800 million
206.article_body: BYJU'S announced on Friday it has raised $800 million in a new funding round as the edtech startup prepares to file for an IPO. Its Co-founder and CEO Byju Raveendran has personally invested $400 million in the current round, which saw participation from Sumeru Ventures, Vitruvian Partners and BlackRock. BYJU'S is now valued at about $22 billion, as per reports.

207.title: He's Modi ji's son: J&K man thanks govt as son evacuated from Ukraine
207.article_body: A man from J&K thanked the Central government as his son was evacuated from war-torn Ukraine's Sumy and reached Delhi today under Operation Ganga. He said, "I want to say...it's [PM Narendra Modi ji's] son who has returned, not my son...We had no hopes given the circumstances in Sumy." "I'm thankful to...Government of India for evacuating my son," he added.

208.title: UP CM Adityanath tenders his resignation day after winning polls
208.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath tendered his resignation to Governor Anandiben Patel on Friday. BJP won 255 of the total 403 seats in UP, becoming the first ruling party to return to power in the state in 37 years. Before tendering his resignation, Adityanath chaired the last cabinet meeting of his first tenure as UP CM.

209.title: No security reasons to leave: Indian embassy in guidelines for students in Russia
209.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, the Indian embassy in guidelines for Indian students in Russia said that there are currently "no security reasons for them to leave". It, however, said that there are certain disruptions in banking services in Russia and direct flight connectivity to India and students concerned over these aspects may consider returning to India.

210.title: Zverev knows he was wrong, he recognised that very early: Nadal
210.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev's apology for lashing out at chair umpire in Acapulco last month, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said the world number three knows that he was wrong. "He recognised that very early...that's a positive thing," he added. Zverev was disqualified at Mexican Open for hitting umpire's chair with his racket many times following a doubles defeat.

211.title: Stellar explosion pushed particles close to cosmic speed limit: Study
211.article_body: A study published on Thursday said a massive explosion in a white dwarf star called nova accelerated particles close to cosmic speed limit. Scientists said gamma rays which were obtained from the shockwave were pushed close to theoretical speed limit which is near to the speed of light. The team used High Energy Stereoscopic System (HESS) to observe the explosion.

212.title: Dog floods kitchen by turning on tap in UK house, causes damage worth ₹4 lakh
212.article_body: A dog, which learnt how to turn on a kitchen tap, flooded the room of his owners' house in the UK, while they were out, causing them damage worth £4,000 (around ₹4 lakh). The incident was caught on the house's security camera which showed the dog standing on its hind legs to reach the tap at the kitchen sink.

213.title: Russian space agency head bars employees from leaving country: Report
213.article_body: Dmitry Rogozin, Head of Russian space agency Roscosmos prohibited agency employees from travelling abroad in order to curb brain drain, reported Kamil Galeev, a Moscow-based journalist. This comes as skilled professionals from IT, engineering, and hard sciences are leaving en masse, Galeev added. Reportedly, border guards are instructed to stop IT engineers, specialists from leaving the country.

214.title: Tina Ambani shares pics from son Anmol Ambani's wedding featuring Bachchan family
214.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani took to Instagram on Friday to share pictures from the wedding of their son Anmol Ambani to Khrisha Shah. "A new chapter begins for Anmol and Khrisha with blessings from friends and family - the wedding," she wrote in the caption of the post. One of the photos features Amitabh Bachchan and his family.

215.title: Ex-Financial Services Secretary Debasish Panda appointed IRDAI Chairman
215.article_body: The government on Friday appointed Debasish Panda as Chairman of Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI). The appointment comes nearly 11 months after the post fell vacant following the completion of Subhash Chandra Khuntia's term in May last year. Panda is a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Uttar Pradesh cadre who retired as Financial Services Secretary this year.

216.title: Jailed Putin critic Navalny calls for anti-war protests across Russia
216.article_body: Jailed Russian President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny has called for more anti-war protests across Russia on Sunday. "Putin will most quickly be stopped by the people of Russia now if they oppose the war," Navalny said. Over 13,900 people have been detained at anti-war demonstrations in Russia since the start of the invasion, according to a protest monitoring group.

217.title: Putin's idea of blitzkrieg in Ukraine failed: Ex-Ukrainian Prez
217.article_body: Speaking on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko on Thursday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "understands that his idea of blitzkrieg has failed". He claimed that Ukraine's military and the unity of the Ukrainian people had slowed the Russian advance. "Please get out from Ukrainian soil...Please stop killing Ukrainians," Poroshenko added.

218.title: Russian forces used cluster bombs in Ukraine: UN human rights office
218.article_body: Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Friday said they have received credible reports of Russian forces using cluster munitions in populated areas in Ukraine. The office added indiscriminate use of such weapons is prohibited under international law. On February 28, Ukraine's rights groups had accused Russia of using cluster bombs during attacks on Ukrainian cities.

219.title: Drone apparently flying from Ukraine crashes in Croatia, none injured
219.article_body: Croatian authorities on Friday said a drone that apparently flew from Ukrainian war zone crashed in Croatian capital, Zagreb, creating a loud blast but no injuries. As per Croatia's National Security Council, a "pilotless military aircraft" entered the country's airspace from neighbouring Hungary. Meanwhile, Zagreb Mayor Tomislav Tomašević said initial findings suggested that it was an accident.

220.title: Kamala Harris laughs when asked about Ukrainian refugee crisis, criticised
220.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris, while addressing a press conference with Polish President Andrzej Duda, was asked by a journalist if the US was willing to make a "specific allocation for Ukrainian refugees". Harris broke into laughter before saying, "A friend in need is a friend indeed." The clip was widely circulated online with many criticising Harris for laughing.

221.title: Congrats erstwhile Lok Sabha benchmate Bhagwant: Tharoor on AAP's win
221.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor congratulated AAP leader Bhagwant Mann, who shared a bench with him in Lok Sabha, for winning Punjab. "Two pulmonologists and four eye surgeons among 13 doctors who are now AAP MLAs, the highest ever...Let's wish them luck," he tweeted. He also congratulated BJP for winning four states and added that Congress' convictions and values will prevail.

222.title: CEO rejects $100 mn offer for CB Insights, says 'never reply to Twitter DMs'
222.article_body: CB Insights' Indian-American CEO Anand Sanwal revealed he has declined a $100 million offer to acquire his market intelligence platform. Sharing screenshots of his conversation with the potential buyer, Sanwal tweeted, "A great reminder to never check or respond to Twitter DMs again." "You just missed the opportunity of a lifetime," the buyer told Sanwal after he rejected their offer.

223.title: It's like home venue for Kohli: Nikhil on pink-ball Test in Bengaluru
223.article_body: Referring to upcoming India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test in Bengaluru, ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said M Chinnaswamy Stadium is like a "home venue" for Virat Kohli as he has represented RCB many times here. "He has played more here in comparison to Delhi, [from] where he belongs. The way he's batting...can see him scoring that hundred pretty soon," he added.

224.title: Pune Int'l Film Festival concludes; Potra wins best Marathi Film award
224.article_body: The 20th edition of the Pune International Film Festival concluded at the National Film Archive of India on Thursday. While 'Potra' won the Best Marathi film title award, the Spanish film 'Between Two Dawns' won the Best International Film award in the Global Cinema Competition. "This year, we received...80 entries in...Marathi film competition category," PIFF Chairman Jabbar Patel said.

225.title: We sold ₹100 product for ₹5, it harmed Pakistani cricket: Rashid Latif on Rawalpindi Test
225.article_body: Talking about Rawalpindi Test between Australia and Pakistan which ended in a draw, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "This series is about marketing our cricket." "I'd want a ₹100 product to be marketed as ₹150 product but in Rawalpindi...we sold a ₹100 product for ₹5 and it harmed our cricket," he added. ICC rated Rawalpindi pitch as 'below average'.

226.title: India issues statement after Indian missile lands in Pak, calls it 'accidental firing'
226.article_body: India has issued a statement after Pakistan claimed that an unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed on its soil on Wednesday. "In the course of a routine maintenance, a technical malfunction led to the accidental firing of a missile...It is learnt that the missile landed in an area of Pakistan...The incident is deeply regrettable," government said.

227.title: KTR inaugurates theme park, crematorium in Hyderabad's Uppal
227.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Friday inaugurated multiple new projects in Hyderabad's Uppal constituency including a theme park. The theme park at Uppal junction has been developed by Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation at a cost of ₹2.17 crore. Rao also inaugurated a modern crematorium called Vaikuntadhamam and laid foundation stones for a sewage treatment plant and a flyover.

228.title: Man kills teen after he bumps into him on road in Thane, arrested
228.article_body: The Thane Police arrested a 24-year-old man, Siraj Ansari, for allegedly murdering an 18-year-old boy after he accidentally bumped into the former while walking on the road on Monday. Police said the accused thrashed the victim and smashed his head with a stone before dumping his body. Ansari was arrested and he confessed to the crime, police added.

229.title: Russia opens case against Meta for allowing users to 'call for murder' of Russians
229.article_body: After Meta Platforms allowed Facebook and Instagram users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war, Russia said it’s opening a criminal case against Meta for "calling for the murder" of its citizens. Prosecutors also requested a Russian court to brand Meta as "extremist" and restrict access to Instagram in the country.

230.title: Woman once said 'You have big breasts, must have lot of sex': Sayantani
230.article_body: Television actress Sayantani Ghosh has revealed that a woman once told her that her breast size is on the higher side, adding that she must be having a lot of sex. "I don't even know what was that supposed to mean...I was a virgin then," the actress added. She further said that such things can unknowingly scar a person.

231.title: Hyd techie sent obscene pics & messages to women on Instagram, held
231.article_body: A 22-year-old techie has been arrested by Hyderabad Police for sending abusive messages and obscene photos to a woman through fake Instagram IDs. The accused, Talluri Krishna, was in the habit of creating such IDs and sending vulgar messages and photos to unknown women, police said, adding, he had once participated in a "nude video call" with an unknown person.

232.title: People raise 'Fadnavis go back' slogans on his visit to Pune; booked
232.article_body: Pune Police have booked 14 people for protesting and sloganeering against the BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis. The former Maharashtra CM, Fadnavis, was in Pimpri-Chinchwad for an inauguration ceremony at a wrestling centre on March 6 when the people raised slogans against him. The protesters raised slogans like "Fadnavis go back", "Corrupt Pimpri Chinchwad BJP", according to the police.

233.title: Psychologist's presence helping India Women a lot in WC: Head coach Powar
233.article_body: India Women head coach Ramesh Powar said presence of sports psychologist Dr Mugdha Bavare is helping the team in ongoing Women's World Cup. "The way Pooja Vastrakar and Sneh Rana addressed that [against Pakistan] collapse...is a part of mindset (and) that's what she works on," he added. Bavare is first psychologist to travel with Indian women's team on a tour.

234.title: Putin planning terrorist attack on Chernobyl nuclear plant, will blame us: Ukraine
234.article_body: Ukraine on Friday claimed that Russian President Vladimir Putin is planning a terrorist attack on Chernobyl nuclear power plant (CNPP). "A man-made catastrophe is planed at the CNPP controlled by Russian forces, for which the occupiers will try to shift responsibility to Ukraine," Defence intelligence of Ukraine tweeted. Earlier, Ukraine said Russia recruited 16,000 ex-ISIS fighters to fight them.

235.title: Mumbai's 2nd viewing deck expected to open by March-end
235.article_body: A second viewing deck is expected to open in Mumbai by March-end after one opened in Dadar last month. The new deck, a part of Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray's Tactical Urbanism concept, will be constructed on a stormwater outfall drain at Walkeshwar at a cost of ₹4 crore. It will offer views of Marine Drive and the Arabian Sea.

236.title: B'luru Police chief to address people's traffic grievances tomorrow
236.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday said that he will address people's traffic grievances tomorrow on 'Sanchara Samparka Divasa'. He tweeted, "I shall be available at MR Convention Hall, Mysore Road, Byatarayanapura Traffic Police Station limits from 11 AM to 1 PM this Saturday...to address traffic grievances." All traffic police officials will also meet the public, he further said.

237.title: Start of hovercraft service between Mumbai, Navi Mumbai delayed again
237.article_body: Plans to run hovercraft services between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai have been delayed again due to the Ukraine-Russia crisis. A Maharashtra Maritime Board (MMB) official said the private agency that was given a Letter of Intent in 2019 was to bring the hovercraft from Russia. The services were initially expected to begin in 2020 but were delayed due to COVID-19.

238.title: Bro sometimes lives below poverty line: Grimes on Musk not buying a new mattress
238.article_body: In an interview, Grimes remarked that the world’s richest man Elon Musk sometimes lives "below the poverty line". Speaking about when they had found a hole in her side of the mattress and Musk suggested that they bring over the mattress from her home instead, she said, "Like, bro wouldn't even get a new mattress…Bro doesn't live like a billionaire."

239.title: DS Patwalia resigns as Punjab's AG a day after poll results
239.article_body: Punjab Advocate-General Deepinder Singh Patwalia tendered his resignation on Friday, a day after Punjab election results confirmed that AAP would form the next government. "In view of the...constitutional convention, I hereby tender my resignation," he said. Patwalia was appointed in November 2021 after his predecessor APS Deol resigned. Deol's appointment was criticised by many within Congress.

240.title: There are certain positive shifts in talks with Ukraine: Putin
240.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to his Belarusian counterpart Alexander Lukashenko about talks with Ukraine amid war and told him, "There are certain positive shifts, negotiators on our side tell me." He added that talks continued "practically on a daily basis". Putin did not elaborate on the remarks, but said that he would go into more detail with Lukashenko.

241.title: Paytm Payments Bank stopped by RBI from onboarding new customers
241.article_body: RBI has directed Paytm Payments Bank Ltd to stop onboarding of new customers with immediate effect. "The bank has also been directed to appoint an IT audit firm to conduct a comprehensive System Audit of its IT system," an order read. "Onboarding of new customers...will be subject to specific permission granted by RBI after reviewing report of...IT auditors," it said.

242.title: Delhi-NCR gets its longest zipline in an army theme park at Manesar
242.article_body: Delhi-NCR region has got its longest zipline in an army theme park, Delta 105, in Manesar, a report stated. The zipline extends for around 224 metres and the starting point is 40-foot-high, making it the highest zipline in Delhi-NCR. It accommodates two people at one particular time. The park reportedly allows people to experience the training that soldiers go through.

243.title: Pratik Pota resigns as CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks to 'explore external opportunity'
243.article_body: Pratik Pota has resigned as the CEO and whole time director of Jubilant FoodWorks as he wished to pursue an external opportunity, the company informed in a filing to stock exchanges. The company added that Pota will continue in his current role till June 15, 2022. Credited for the company's turnaround, Pota had joined Jubilant FoodWorks in 2017.

244.title: Ukraine situation disconcerting, must support ceasefire talks: China
244.article_body: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Friday said the situation in Ukraine was disconcerting. During a news conference after the annual parliamentary session, Keqiang said it is important to support Russia and Ukraine in ceasefire talks. However, he refused to answer questions whether China would provide economic and financial support to Russia in face of sanctions by Western allies.

245.title: Turkish carrier stops flights to and from Russia for 2 weeks
245.article_body: Turkish airline Pegasus has suspended all flights to and from Russia for two weeks i.e. until March 27 amid financial sanctions imposed on Russia due to its military actions in Ukraine. In a statement, the airline said the company was forced to cease flight operations due to sanctions on insurance, leasing and other operations on flights to and from Russia

246.title: Russia recruited 16,000 ex-ISIS fighters to be used against Ukrainian civilians: Ukraine
246.article_body: Ukraine's presidential adviser Mikhail Podolyak tweeted on Friday that Russian officials, including minister Sergei Shoigu, have announced the hasty recruitment of 16,000 ex-ISIS fighters to be used against Ukrainian civilians. "Hiring ISIS and Russian propaganda claims about chemical weapons testify to an attempt to implement the 'Syrian scenario' in Ukraine," he added.

247.title: Green agriculture, conservation techniques employed in US farms: Govt
247.article_body: US Department of Agriculture (USDA) said farmers adopted conservation strategies to enhance climate-friendly agricultural practices across farms in the country. The findings released on Thursday found that farmers built buffers and wind breaks around fields to prevent soil erosion. The report added that farmers used conservation tillage techniques on over 210 million acres of farms nationwide.

248.title: Italy clears construction of 6 wind farms as part of renewables drive
248.article_body: Italian government has approved construction of six wind energy farms as part of its measures to spur the development of renewable energy. With a capacity of 418 megawatts, the parks will be developed in the regions of Puglia, Basilica and Sardinia. This comes as the government ramps up efforts to lessen reliance on Russian gas imports.

249.title: Global COVID toll may be 3 times the official toll, India saw 4mn deaths: Lancet
249.article_body: The number of people who died of COVID-19 worldwide could be more than three times the official toll of 5.9 million deaths (between January 2020 and December 2021), a study published in Lancet has said. It pegged the actual toll at 18.2 million and said that India saw 4.1 million COVID-19 deaths, accounting for 22% of the total global deaths.

250.title: China locks down city amid worst COVID outbreak in 2 yrs with 1,100 daily cases
250.article_body: China has locked down the northeastern city of Changchun, which has a population of around 90 lakh amid a new spike in COVID-19 cases attributed to the Omicron variant. China on Friday reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily count in around two years. Out of the 1,100 new cases, 397 are local symptomatic cases.

251.title: Sharing stories of Warne has invigorated Australian team: Cummins
251.article_body: Australian Test captain Pat Cummins said his team is "still in disbelief" over the sudden death of legendary spinner Shane Warne on March 4. He added that after sharing various stories of Warne, "players are invigorated" to follow his blueprint in terms of playing to bring wins for team. "He's still one of our favourite ever cricketers," Cummins further said.

252.title: No player would want to sit out after that performance: Bumrah on Jadeja
252.article_body: Responding to a query about whether Ravindra Jadeja will be rested for India's second Test against Sri Lanka, Jasprit Bumrah said he doesn't think any player would want to sit out after a performance like Jadeja's. Jadeja scored 175* in the first innings of the Mohali Test followed by a nine-wicket haul. He was named Player of the Match.

253.title: Drug peddler arrested with 7 kg ganja worth ₹8 lakh in Bengaluru
253.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police arrested a drug peddler on Friday. The crime branch has also seized seven kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹8 lakh, from the accused person's possession. It has also recovered ₹65,000 in cash and other items from the accused person, who is said to be from Odisha.

254.title: Steve Smith trolls himself over tweet on Australia's new debutant
254.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith took to Twitter to congratulate leg-spinner Mitchell Swepson, who'll be making his Test debut against Pakistan. "It's been a while since a leg-spinner debuted for Australia in Tests. I have no doubt Swepson will be far more successful than the last leggie," he wrote. Notably, Smith had made his debut for Australia as a leg-spinner.

255.title: Appreciate the Pakistan batters instead of saying they played slow: Babar
255.article_body: Reacting to criticism over Pakistan's run rate in the opening Test against Australia, Babar Azam said the Pakistan batters should be appreciated adding that they did not bat slowly. "Abdullah Shafique [played]...his fourth Test and Imam-ul-Haq was making his comeback," stated Babar. Pakistan scored 476 runs in the first innings with Imam, Azhar Ali scoring 157, 185 respectively.

256.title: I was just too greedy: 'Jalsa' director on casting Vidya, Shefali
256.article_body: Director Suresh Triveni has said that he was just too greedy when he thought of bringing actresses Vidya Balan and Shefali Shah together for 'Jalsa'. He has previously worked with Vidya in 2017 film 'Tumhari Sulu'. "Working with [Vidya]...you want to go back to her with another film...And of course, I've been following Shefali's work for some time," Suresh said.

257.title: Against our values: Germany's Deutsche Bank refuses to cut off ties with Russia
257.article_body: Amid various brands suspending their operations in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, Germany’s largest bank Deutsche Bank refused to cut ties with Russia. Bank’s Chief Executive Christian Sewing said, "We are often asked why we aren't withdrawing completely from Russia. The answer is that this would go against our values." Sewing added, "We've clients who cannot exit Russia overnight."

258.title: Russian soldiers' bodies seen scattered on snow; Ukrainian says 'leaving them for dogs'
258.article_body: Dead bodies of several Russian soldiers have been seen lying in the snow near Kharkiv in Ukraine. When asked about what will be done about the bodies, one of the Ukrainian soldiers said, "What do you think will happen, we will leave them for the dogs." A soldier said that Ukrainians are fighting to protect their families and land.

259.title: Sachin told batters to attack Warne while leading Mumbai: Ex-coach
259.article_body: Ex-Indian fast bowler Balwinder Singh Sandhu who was Sachin Tendulkar's coach while he was representing Mumbai, said Sachin asked all the Mumbai players to "attack" late cricketer Shane Warne, during a three-day game against Australia. "The plan to attack Warne worked well as it not only benefited the Mumbai team but also the Indian team," added Balwinder.

260.title: Pune's Bharosa Cell resolved 1,675 family disputes in 2021: Report
260.article_body: The Bharosa Cell of Pune Police has resolved 1,675 cases related to family disputes in 2021, according to Hindustan Times. A police official said that most of the disputes were among couples. "Their grievances are heard and senior officers of the team resolve them through counselling and patient hearing," the official added.

261.title: We weren't satisfied with screenplay: Akshay on OTT debut getting delayed
261.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar, while talking about his OTT debut 'The End' being delayed again, said, "We were not satisfied with the screenplay. Amazon was not satisfied." The film, which was announced in 2019, was due to start at the end of this year. "If everything goes well, we should start by next year's beginning," Akshay added.

262.title: I'm not a method actor, I don't take it seriously: Akshay Kumar
262.article_body: Akshay Kumar, sharing his opinion on method acting, said, "I don't take it too seriously and it's called acting for a reason." "I'm not the one to lock myself in a room...I just want to act and go home. I'm not a method actor, I don't claim to be one," he added. Akshay will be next seen in 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

263.title: Want seniors to put their hands up: Powar on India's loss vs NZ in WC
263.article_body: Following India's loss against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, India's head coach Ramesh Powar said he wants seniors like Mithali Raj, Smriti Mandhana and Jhulan Goswami to put their hands up and help team win games single-handedly. "Because their participation...contributions in the win will brush off on...younger players," he added. It was India's first loss in the tournament.

264.title: Difficult for 2nd India-Sri Lanka Test to last beyond 3 days: Jaffer
264.article_body: Talking about Team India's second Test against Sri Lanka, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it is "difficult" for the match to last beyond three days, considering the performances of Sri Lanka. "There are many things that need to go in [Sri Lanka's] favour," added Jaffer. India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the opening Test.

265.title: Cong will never learn: Amarinder Singh on party's Punjab performance
265.article_body: Captain Amarinder Singh, who remained Punjab CM for over four years before being removed due to infighting in Congress, on Friday said Congress leadership will never learn after the party failed to retain power in Punjab. His response came after Congress blamed him for the results. "Who's responsible for the humiliating defeat...in UP? What about Manipur, Goa, Uttarakhand?" Singh asked.

266.title: My kids say 'Pops, this is old fashion' if I get trends wrong: Ajay
266.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has stated that he asks his kids, nephews and everybody younger than him what's cool because the language changes every three months. "I mean there are terms which are used and then you learn that term and use it and after three months, they turn around and say 'Pops, this is old fashion'," the actor added.

267.title: Bhagwant Mann meets Kejriwal, touches his feet after AAP's win in Punjab
267.article_body: A day after Aam Aadmi Party won the Punjab Assembly election, the party's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann met the party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi. A video shared by an AAP leader on Twitter showed Mann touching the feet of Kejriwal before hugging him. Mann was also seen touching the feet of AAP leader Manish Sisodia.

268.title: COVID-19 situation in Germany still critical: Health Minister
268.article_body: German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach urged people not to assume that coronavirus pandemic is over. COVID-19 situation in Germany is still "critical", he said. "We've strongly rising case figures again...I keep reading that...Omicron...is a milder variant and that's only true to a limited extent," Lauterbach added. Germany has reported more than 2,50,000 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

269.title: Maruti among over 70 firms selected for auto components PLI scheme: Report
269.article_body: The government has selected over 70 companies for the auto components PLI scheme, Moneycontrol reported citing a report. Maruti Suzuki, Delphi TVS, Hella India, Dana Group, Minda Industries, Tata Auto Components, Bharat Forge are among the selected applicants. Firms from Germany, the US, the Netherlands, Japan, South Korea, France and Italy have also been selected.

270.title: Nazara Technologies to invest ₹30 cr in Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll
270.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed gaming and sports media platform Nazara Technologies has committed to invest ₹30 crore into Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll. Nazara will invest up to ₹10 crore upfront while the rest of ₹20 crore will be deployed over a period of 3 years. Griffin Gaming Partners had led a $65-million funding into social gaming platform Winzo.

271.title: 64 women rescued, 9 held after police raids illegal dance bar in B'luru
271.article_body: Nine people were detained for allegedly running an illegal dance bar at a restaurant and bar in Bengaluru. The Central Crime Branch officers conducted a raid and rescued 64 women from the bar on Wednesday. As per police, these women were initially hired as waitresses but later they were forced to wear obscene outfits and dance in front of customers.

272.title: Amyra Dastur donates bags, stationery, clothes to underprivileged kids
272.article_body: Amyra Dastur, known for films like 'Rajma Chawal' and 'Prassthanam', has donated school bags, stationery and clothes to the children of Shiksha Seva Foundation. She said "this is a small way" to help those kids who either dropped out of schools or stopped their education due to low finances amid COVID-19. "No one should be limited by...financial situation," Amyra added.

273.title: Nkrumah Bonner's century helps WI secure first innings lead against England
273.article_body: West Indies managed to get a 62-run lead with their first innings score being 373/9 at stumps on Day 3 of the Antigua Test on Thursday. Nkrumah Bonner's nine-hour-long knock of 123 runs was the standout performance of the day's play. English pacer Craig Overton and all-rounder Ben Stokes managed to pick two wickets each.

274.title: WV Raman put incredible pressure, players feared speaking to him: Ashwin
274.article_body: Sharing his experience while being trained under ex-India cricketer and former Tamil Nadu coach WV Raman, Ravichandran Ashwin said Raman inflicted "incredible" pressure on players, adding that players feared speaking to him. "If you didn't throw the ball at the top of the stumps, he would just have a go. He used to prod me," added Ashwin.

275.title: Every bowler with little pace fancies his chances against Rohit: Gavaskar
275.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said every bowler with a little pace "fancies" his chances while bowling to Rohit Sharma because of his pull shot, which creates an opportunity as he hits the ball in the air. "He should put it in cold storage till he gets to 80,90,100," added Gavaskar. "The percentages are not working in his favour," stated Gavaskar.

276.title: Don't blame him for trying to nullify the opposition: Cummins on Raja
276.article_body: Talking about Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja's statement that the Rawalpindi pitch was flat to "not play" into Australia's hands, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said he does not blame Raja for trying to "nullify" his team. "I found it a real positive that they went away from a wicket they would traditionally play there," added Cummins.

277.title: Telangana CM KCR hospitalised over pain in left arm, advised rest
277.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao was on Friday admitted to Yashoda Hospital in Somajiguda after he complained of pain in his left arm. His physician Dr MV Rao said he had been feeling weak for the past two days. No problem surfaced after an angiogram, hospital authorities said, adding that he was advised to rest for one week.

278.title: Prithviraj’s preponement brings huge smile to my face: Manushi Chhillar
278.article_body: Former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said she is extremely happy that her debut film 'Prithviraj' is releasing a week earlier. "The film was postponed twice due to the pandemic. So, its preponement definitely brings a huge smile to my face," Manushi said. Directed by Padma Shri Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, the film also stars Akshay Kumar and Sanjay Dutt.

279.title: SpiceJet MD granted interim relief from arrest in alleged cheating case
279.article_body: SpiceJet promoter and Managing Director Ajay Singh has been granted interim protection from arrest by a Delhi court in connection with an alleged cheating case registered against him. The court said that no coercive action should be taken against Ajay Singh till March 28. It has further directed him to join the investigation regarding the transfer of SpiceJet shares.

280.title: It'll take us back 100 years: Russian tycoon on seizing assets of firms exiting Russia
280.article_body: Russia's richest person and President of Norilsk Nickel Vladimir Potanin warned that confiscating the assets of Western companies that left Russia after Ukraine's invasion will "take us back 100 years to 1917". "We shouldn't try to slam the door but endeavour to preserve Russia's economic position in those markets which we spent so long cultivating," the 61-year-old added.

281.title: Aditya Roy Kapur as a co-star is unmatchable: Sanjana Sanghi
281.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi while talking to ETimes said Aditya Roy Kapur is "unmatchable" as a co-star. "I know that even if he is trying to criticise my performance, it's coming from a good place," Sanjana said, adding, "[We] share...immense comfort in being able to express anything that's on our minds." They will be seen together in 'Om: The Battle Within'.

282.title: CM Bommai plans to build 4 new 'satellite towns' around Bengaluru
282.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday suggested that the Bengaluru city should be developed like a "planet surrounded by four satellites". He said, "Bengaluru should be...like a planet where there will be satellite towns along with the best of connectivity with rail, road, hi-tech travel systems." He added that at least four new Bengalurus have to be built around Bengaluru.

283.title: Google to send air raid alerts to Android users in Ukraine before expected attacks
283.article_body: Google will start sending air raid alerts to Android users in Ukraines before expected attacks happen near them. "Tragically, millions of people in Ukraine now rely on air strike alerts to try get to safety," Google noted, adding that it's working with Ukrainian government to roll out the feature starting today. The feature is adapted from Google's earthquake alert system.

284.title: Jaishankar praises Op Ganga, says evacuation from Sumy was challenging
284.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday praised the authorities for smooth implementation of Operation Ganga. He, however, said the evacuation of Indians from Sumy was particularly challenging. "Op Ganga, undertaken at the direction of PM Modi has delivered due to both leadership and commitment," he said. He also thanked Ukraine, its neighbours and Russia for their cooperation.

285.title: It would be a big mistake to close EU's door to Ukraine: Belgian PM
285.article_body: Belgian PM Alexander De Croo said it would be "big mistake" to close the European Union door to  Ukraine. However, he added that Ukraine must respect all the necessary procedural steps before it can become a member. He further said, "An EU membership process requires a lot of reforms...otherwise we'll have countries that will become members...without being ready for it."

286.title: DiDi halts Hong Kong listing on cybersecurity probe: Report
286.article_body: China's DiDi Global has suspended preparations for its planned Hong Kong listing after failing to appease Chinese regulators' demands that it overhaul its systems for handling sensitive user data, Bloomberg reported. China's CAC told the firm its proposals to prevent security and data leaks had fallen short. DiDi's main apps, removed from local app stores last year, will remain suspended.

287.title: Sisodia directs PWD to start repair works on Delhi roads by March 17
287.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has directed Public Works Department (PWD) to start repair works on city's roads by March 17. Sisodia has asked officials to repair all potholes by March 17 and complete patchwork by March 31. "All desilting...cleaning works should be done by May 31," a PWD order read. Sisodia was given additional charge of PWD in February.

288.title: Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh welcomes 2nd baby, calls him 'baby shark'
288.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Ghazal Alagh welcomed her second baby with husband Varun Alagh on Thursday. Sharing a photo on Instagram, she wrote, "And then there were 2, our second son Ayaan is here to make our lives even more fun. Ayaan means 'blessing from god' and that’s what he is. Thanks for all the kind wishes and blessings. #babyshark"

289.title: Stereotypes are actor's drawback, producer's cash cow: Arshad Warsi
289.article_body: Actor Arshad Warsi has called getting stereotyped a problem, adding that it is an actor's drawback and a producer's cash cow. "This guy does good action...Make him do it again and again," the actor said. Arshad added that most actors including himself are always on the lookout for something new but it has to happen organically and can't be engineered.

290.title: Akhilesh Yadav should seek forensic tests of EVM machines: Mamata
290.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee alleged that BJP won the Uttar Pradesh polls due to "loot and malpractices of EVM". She further told SP chief Akhilesh Yadav not to be "disheartened" and asked him to seek forensic tests of the same EVM machines. Lauding Akhilesh, she said, SP's vote percentage increased from 20% to 37% in this Assembly election.

291.title: NASA to open moon sample sealed 50 yrs ago to study them in new ways
291.article_body: NASA is about to open vacuum-sealed sample of moon collected during Apollo 17 mission in 1972. "Agency knew science and technology would evolve and allow scientists to study...material in new ways to address new questions," NASA's Lori Glaze said. This sample is expected to contain some gases. A different tool has been designed to capture these gases for further research.

292.title: Elephant dies due to electrocution in Assam's Kaziranga National Park
292.article_body: Forest officials informed that an elephant had died due to electrocution at Burapahar Tea Estate in Assam's Kaziranga National Park on Friday. P Sivakumar, Director, Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve, confirmed that the area where the accident took place falls under the Hatidandi animal corridor. The elephant died after it reportedly came in contact with an electric transformer.

293.title: Bhagwant Mann to take oath as Punjab CM on March 16
293.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Bhagwant Mann will take oath as the CM of Punjab on March 16. He has invited party President and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for the swearing-in ceremony. Mann will also hold a roadshow in Amritsar on March 13 along with Kejriwal. The Aam Aadmi Party won 92 seats in the Punjab Assembly elections.

294.title: People expect me to be sexy, sensual; I've typecast myself: Sunny
294.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone has stated that she has typecast herself as people expect her to play a glamorous character and assume some sort of sexuality or sensuality is involved. "There are still lots of people who come to us saying, 'It is Sunny, we have to show this or that (something sexual)' and it doesn't bother me," the actress said.

295.title: EU aims to double military aid for Ukraine: Foreign policy chief
295.article_body: The European Union aims to double its military aid to Ukraine amid the invasion by Russia, EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Friday. The EU has proposed earmarking another 500 million euros for this purpose, Borrell added. The EU is also considering imposing more sanctions on Russian oligarchs and the Russian economy, he further said.

296.title: It was an absolute outlier: Pat Cummins on Rawalpindi Test
296.article_body: Talking about the drawn first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Australia Test skipper Pat Cummins said it was an absolute outlier. In all, 1,187 runs were scored for the loss of 14 wickets in the Test. Notably, the ICC even rated the pitch below average and handed it one demerit point. Second Test will begin on Saturday in Karachi.

297.title: Delhi Police arrests man & recovers 8 kilograms of ganja; probe on
297.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday arrested a man and recovered about eight kilograms of ganja from his possession. The accused person had allegedly come with a consignment of the contraband to deliver it to an unknown receiver in the Vikas Nagar area in Ranhola. Meanwhile, Delhi Police has launched an investigation to trace the source of ganja and its receivers.

298.title: 1 Army pilot killed, 1 injured in helicopter crash near LoC in Kashmir
298.article_body: One of the two pilots in the Indian Army Cheetah helicopter that crashed earlier today in North Kashmir's Gurez sector has died, Army officials said. The other pilot has been injured, officials said as per ANI. More details are awaited on the incident that reportedly took place due to poor weather.

299.title: Organised dad's evacuation from Kyiv, it was nerve-wracking: Director Stanislav
299.article_body: Ukrainian director Stanislav Kapralov spoke about how he and his friends evacuated his father from Kyiv amid the Russian invasion. Calling it an "incredibly nerve-wracking operation", Stanislav said, "He'd to be taken...to the point of evacuation. My friends agreed to pick him up." "He left with one backpack. Thank God, everything's fine and three days later, [he's]...in Warsaw," he added.

300.title: US startup Astrolab unveils rover that can be driven by astronauts on Moon
300.article_body: US startup Venturi Astrolab has unveiled a full-scale prototype of a new rover 'FLEX' designed to transport cargo and astronauts across Moon's surface. FLEX, which can be driven by astronauts, went through a five-day field test in a desert. If NASA adopts FLEX for Artemis, it would become the first passenger-capable rover to travel Moon's surface since Apollo 17 mission.

301.title: Odisha to conduct matriculation exam in offline mode from April 29
301.article_body: The Odisha government has decided to conduct the matriculation examination in offline mode from April 29. "It will be mandatory for all students...The exam would be held for one subject each day," state Chief Secretary SC Mahapatra said. The annual high school, Sanskrit board and State Open School examinations are slated to be held between April 29 and May 6.

302.title: CBSE releases date sheet for Class 10 and Class 12 Term 2 board exams
302.article_body: CBSE on Friday released the date sheet for both Class 10 and Class 12 Term 2 board examinations. The examinations are scheduled from April 26, 2022. The time of the start of the examination will be 10:30 am. Other competitive examinations including JEE Main have been taken care of while preparing the date sheet, said CBSE.

303.title: How has the COVID-19 pandemic changed after 2 years according to experts?
303.article_body: With countries shifting toward a return to normal after two years of COVID-19, US-based expert Neil J Sehgal said, "Every country will have to learn to live with COVID-19." Officials encourage use of masks, ventilating spaces, instead of advising to wipe down surfaces like they did earlier. WHO has cleared 10 vaccines, with several anti-viral drugs and pills in circulation.

304.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami resigns, to continue as acting Uttarakhand CM
304.article_body: Uttarakhand CM and BJP leader Pushkar Singh Dhami, along with his state cabinet, resigned on Friday, a day after results for polls were announced. "He [Governor] told me to continue until the new government is sworn in...We've received the love of people and saw unprecedented results," Dhami said. Though BJP retained power in Uttarakhand, Dhami lost from the Khatima seat.

305.title: Former NSE official Anand Subramanian denies being 'yogi' who influenced Chitra
305.article_body: After the CBI informed a Delhi court that he impersonated the 'Himalayan yogi' to influence former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's decisions, Anand Subramanian through his lawyer said, "I'm not the 'yogi'". Subramanian's lawyer argued that the co-location scam took place between 2010 and 2014 while the accused had joined in 2013. The CBI argued that Subramanian was a flight risk.

306.title: Anushka Sharma shares video from her cricket training for 'Chakda 'Xpress'
306.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to give a glimpse of how she's preparing for her next film, 'Chakda 'Xpress', where she'll play the role of Indian cricketer Jhulan Goswami. She shared a video wherein she's seen practising on a field and doing some workout routines. "Get-Sweat-Go! Chakda 'Xpress prep getting hard and intense as we are counting days," Anushka wrote.

307.title: 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since war began: UN
307.article_body: The International Organization for Migration said 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since Russia began invading the country on February 24. "The number of people in need of urgent humanitarian assistance is increasing by the hour," it added. Separately, the UN High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi said "about two million people are displaced inside Ukraine" due to "senseless war".

308.title: Justice Vipin Sanghi appointed acting Chief Justice of Delhi HC
308.article_body: Justice Vipin Sanghi has been appointed as the acting Chief Justice of the Delhi High Court. Justice Sanghi will take charge from "March 13 consequent upon the retirement of Justice Dhirubhai Naranbhai Patel, CJ, Delhi High Court", the official notification read. The 60-year-old was appointed as an Additional Judge of the Delhi High Court in 2006.

309.title: Police officer found dead at friend's rented room in J&K's Rajouri
309.article_body: A 36-year-old police officer, who hails from Poonch, was found dead at a friend's rented room in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri on Thursday. The friend, who is also a police officer, was not present in the rented room when the incident occurred, an official said. The official added that prima facie, the case appears to be of suicide.

310.title: I accept people's mandate: KP Maurya on poll defeat in UP's Sirathu
310.article_body: After facing defeat in the UP Assembly elections, UP's Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said that he is worker of BJP, and will do whatever the party tells him to do. Maurya lost from the Sirathu Assembly seat by 7,337 votes to SP's Pallavi Patel. "With all humility, I accept the mandate of the people of Sirathu constituency," he added.

311.title: Russian forces killed more Ukrainian civilians than soldiers: Ukraine
311.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said that Russian forces invading Ukraine have killed more Ukrainian civilians than soldiers. "I want this to be heard not only in Kyiv but all over the world," Reznikov added. Separately, Russia's main attack force in northern Ukraine has been stalled on a highway north of Kyiv since the initial days of...invasion, according to Reuters.

312.title: Central agencies should join CCTNS for effective policing: Amit Shah
312.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said all the central agencies should join the Crime and Criminal Tracking Network & Systems (CCTNS) for effective policing through e-governance. While addressing the 37th Foundation Day celebrations of the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB), Shah further suggested the states to use NCRB data to form their yearly police force strategy.

313.title: Have to make mental adjustments while preparing for pink-ball Tests: Bumrah
313.article_body: India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said his side is making "mental adjustments" ahead of Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru, as pink-ball Tests are a "fairly new concept". He added, "Playing under light, fielding and bowling with pink ball are things we need to get used to." It'll be India's third pink-ball Test at home.

314.title: US addresses used China systems for cyberattacks on Russia: Report
314.article_body: Chinese state media Xinhua claimed China has experienced continuous cyberattacks in which US internet addresses have been used to seize control of Chinese computers to target Belarus, Russia and Ukraine. It cited China's cybersecurity technical centre, CNCERT/CC, in its report. "These overseas groups attacked by taking control of computers in the country," the report quoted the centre as saying.

315.title: HC upholds Maha govt's decision denying job to woman over two-child norm
315.article_body: Bombay HC upheld Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation's (MIDC) decision denying employment to a woman in place of her father, who died in 2013, citing the state's two-child norm. MIDC earlier turned down her application for the appointment in 2019. The woman has four siblings and their family was ineligible for a job in place of her father, MIDC had said.

316.title: When 1st floor can be reopened, why not others: HC to Centre on Nizamuddin Markaz
316.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Friday asked the Centre to clear its stand on why is it not allowing the other floors of Nizamuddin Markaz to reopen. This comes after the Centre told the court that it has no objection to allowing people to offer prayers on the first floor on Shab-e-Barat and during the month of Ramadan.

317.title: Army helicopter crashes near LoC in Kashmir, rescue operations on
317.article_body: An Indian Army Cheetah helicopter crashed near the LoC in the Gurez sector in north Kashmir on Friday afternoon, officials said. The helicopter crashed while it was on its way to pick up sick BSF personnel, PTI reported while quoting officials. It was about to land when it "drifted away" due to poor weather and rescue operations are ongoing.

318.title: 2 men on bike snatch woman's gold chain in Gurugram, case filed
318.article_body: Two bike-borne men allegedly snatched the gold chain of a school teacher in Gurugram Sector 40 on Wednesday, while she was returning home. The victim was riding her Activa scooter when the accused rammed her vehicle. "As I stopped the scooter, the accused seated pillion snatched my gold chain," she said. An FIR has been registered.

319.title: Russia bombs psychiatric hospital with 330 people inside in Ukraine
319.article_body: Russian forces have bombed a psychiatric hospital with 330 people inside in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, the regional authorities have claimed. Oleh Synegybov, governor of the region, said that 73 people had been evacuated from the hospital. He further said that some people inside the hospital had been confined to wheelchairs and were unable to move.

320.title: 1st gay couple marries in Chile as same-sex marriage law takes effect
320.article_body: Chile's Javier Silva and Jaime Nazar on Thursday became the first same-sex couple to marry in the South American country after a law allowing same-sex marriage went into effect. "Being the first to get married in Chile is an honour...It's something we didn't think could happen," Silva said. They have been together for seven years and have two adopted children.

321.title: Russia stages military beauty contest for female troops amid Ukraine war
321.article_body: Russia staged a military beauty contest called 'Makeup under Camouflage' for its female troops amid the Ukraine invasion. The first test was the application of combat makeup, according to military magazine Red Star. They were also expected to overcome a fire-assault zone in a mock war zone with radiation, chemical and biological threats wearing gas masks and special protection suits.

322.title: Subramanian thought he can be 'yogi' & no one would identify: CBI to court
322.article_body: The CBI on Friday told a Delhi court that the NSE's former Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian impersonated the 'Himalayan yogi' and influenced the decisions of former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Speaking in the co-location case, the CBI said Subramanian "thought he can be yogi for four years and no one would identify. He was operating the email IDs."

323.title: Cricket Ireland to invest €1.5 million in women's cricket
323.article_body: Cricket Ireland has announced that it will invest €1.5 million to further improve women's cricket in the country. The investment amount is three times more than what the board allocated in 2019. The board will distribute seven full-time contracts this time which means that Ireland will get their first-ever full-professional women's cricketers going into the 2022 summer season.

324.title: Mumbai man convicted in 6 days for kidnapping 6-yr-old, gets 2-yr-jail
324.article_body: A 29-year-old resident of Malad in Mumbai, who had kidnapped a six-year-old girl from Palghar district on March 4, was sentenced to two years of rigorous imprisonment by a magistrate court on Wednesday. The accused was arrested on March 6. He had lured the girl using chocolate and then left her fearing that police may trace him.

325.title: Haryana man arrested in Assam for snatching ATM cards from people
325.article_body: East Guwahati Police Department (EGPD) arrested a man belonging to Haryana's Hisar after they seized 17 ATM cards of different banks from his possession in Guwahati. EGPD took to Twitter to inform that the accused, identified as Ramdiya used to snatch ATM cards from people. Further investigation is underway, police added in the tweet.

326.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to rise up to 36°C over next 6 days
326.article_body: India Meteorological Department has predicted that Delhi's maximum temperature is likely to rise to about 36°C over the next six days. The maximum temperature in the city is likely to rise up to 34°C by March 15 and further to 36°C by March 17. Notably, Delhi's air quality has remained in the "moderate" or "poor" categories from March 1 onwards.

327.title: Husband Goldie Behl told me to come back to work post cancer: Sonali
327.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre has revealed that her husband filmmaker Goldie Behl has been encouraging her to get back to work "for the longest time". The actress was diagnosed with metastatic cancer in 2018 and took a break from work. Sonali has now returned to work as a judge on the reality television show 'Dance India Dance Lil Masters Season 5'.

328.title: Allegations on principal institutions do not seem gracious: Lekhi to Kejriwal
328.article_body: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal alleged that the Centre forced Election Commission to delay MCD polls, BJP's Meenakashi Lekhi said that such allegations on principal institutions "do not seem gracious". "I'd like to ask Kejriwal Ji, can any city survive without Municipal Corporation? As he has now started the process of removing Municipalities," Lekhi added.

329.title: Sometimes sharks sleep with their eyes open, find scientists
329.article_body: Australian scientists have found that sometimes sharks sleep with their eyes wide open. In order to study their sleeping patterns, scientists collected seven draughtsboard sharks from Hauraki Gulf in New Zealand. They found during sleep some sharks remained inactive for more than five minutes with their eyes closed, but 38% of the time their eyes were found to be open.

330.title: Man caught having illicit affair with daughter-in-law kills son in Rajasthan
330.article_body: A 64-year-old man, who was allegedly having an affair with his daughter-in-law, strangulated his son to death in Rajasthan. Police said the deceased's wife was also an accomplice in the crime. The deceased had allegedly caught his father and wife in a compromising position, police added. The accused hanged his body from a fan to make it look like suicide.

331.title: McDonald's burger being sold for ₹26,000 online in Russia after closure; pics surface
331.article_body: After McDonald's announced that it is temporarily shutting down all its restaurants in Russia amid war with Ukraine, several online listings showed people selling McDonald's burgers and meals for high prices in Russia. Some pictures showed burgers being sold for 40,000 rubles (around ₹26,000), while a two bags of McDonald's food was on sale for 100,000 rubles around ₹66,000.

332.title: Got more than 5,000 wedding proposals after 'Baahubali': Prabhas
332.article_body: Actor Prabhas in an interview has revealed that more than 5,000 wedding proposals came for him after his film 'Baahubali'. The actor further said that his mother wants him to get married and he had told her that he will think about it after the film. "I will definitely get married...I will have a love marriage," Prabhas added.

333.title: Richa dresses as Smita Patil for cover of magazine, son Prateik reacts
333.article_body: Richa Chadha took to Instagram to pay tribute to late actress Smita Patil. Richa dressed up like Smita and posed for the cover of a magazine's Women's Day special edition. Sharing the picture, she wrote, "Homage to the inimitable Smita Patil." The late actress' actor-son Prateik Babbar reacted to her post and dropped a heart emoji in the comments section.

334.title: You reap what you sow: Navjot Singh Sidhu on Punjab poll results
334.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Friday reacted to the party's defeat in Punjab Assembly elections, saying, "You reap what you sow." "I'm not going into a deep thought of whether people accepted [Charanjit Channi's] face as CM's candidate or not," he added. Sidhu was also defeated by AAP candidate Jeevan Jyot Kaur from the Amritsar East constituency seat.

335.title: Hyderabad Police busts loan app fraud run by Chinese national; 2 arrested
335.article_body: Hyderabad Police has arrested two persons, both residents of Karnataka, for allegedly cheating people via a loan app run by a Chinese national. Police said the accused offered loans for a short period, following which victims had to pay huge interest. When the victims failed to repay the money, the accused posted their morphed photos on social media, police added.

336.title: 3 heart patients die at Delhi hospital, families blame faulty stents
336.article_body: Three patients with heart blockage have died at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital on Monday. The patients' families alleged the hospital used faulty stents. However, the doctors rejected the allegations, saying two of the three patients were critical and died before the stents could be implanted. Meanwhile, the Delhi government has set up a committee to review the matter.

337.title: Volunteers welcome to help fight against Ukrainian forces: Putin
337.article_body: Speaking at a Russian security council meeting, Russia's President Vladimir Putin said that he wanted to allow volunteers to fight against Ukrainian forces. The Russian Defence Minister said that there were 16,000 volunteers in Middle East who were ready to come to fight in Ukraine. Putin has also approved handing over captured Western missile systems to Russian-backed Ukrainian rebel fighters.

338.title: India's pace bowling is becoming fearsome: Karim ahead of pink-ball Test
338.article_body: Ahead of India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test in Bengaluru, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim said the hosts' pace bowling is becoming fearsome, adding Sri Lanka's batting is weak. "We have bowlers who can generate pace and movement. It will be very difficult for Sri Lanka to compete with them given the circumstances," he added. The Day-Night Test will begin on Saturday.

339.title: Let MCD elections take place: Delhi CM Kejriwal to PM Modi
339.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has urged PM Narendra Modi to let Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections take place and added that deferring the polls would be "a big threat to democracy". "Date for polls was to be announced...on March 9 but the same day...Centre wrote to State EC to combine all three civic bodies into one," Kejriwal added.

340.title: Video of Mann asking 'what is govt?' on a comedy show judged by Sidhu goes viral
340.article_body: An old video of AAP's Bhagwant Mann participating in a comedy show, where Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu was a judge, has gone viral, after Punjab Assembly election results. The video shows Mann explaining what "gormint" (government) means. "The one that looks closely (gaur se) at every issue but forgets about it in a minute is called gormint," he said.

341.title: Child learns to walk only after falling: Ex-Miss Bikini India Archana on losing UP polls
341.article_body: After losing UP polls by getting just 1,519 votes, ex-Miss Bikini India and Congress candidate Archana Gautam said, "I received a lot of love from the people of Hastinapur...I just didn't get their trust." She added, "Very soon, I will also win their trust." She added, "Child learns to walk only after falling...nobody is born having learned from the womb."

342.title: SBI app users spammed with random notifications, bank says fixing issue
342.article_body: Several users of SBI's Yono Lite app took to Twitter on Friday to complain that they were spammed with multiple notifications for instant personal loans. "Since morning I got hundreds of random notifications from Yono app...with different names," one Twitter user wrote. SBI tweeted, "Our technical team is working to resolve this issue. Please bear with us."

343.title: Show respect: Tuchel to Chelsea fans chanting owner Abramovich's name
343.article_body: Reacting to Chelsea fans chanting Russian owner Roman Abramovich's name during the scheduled minute of applause for Ukraine before a Premier League match, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said the fans should show "respect". Abramovich's assets have been frozen due to sanctions by the UK, after "clear evidence" over his connection to Vladimir Putin as per UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

344.title: Godrej Properties launches 3 signature towers in Chandivali-Powai
344.article_body: Godrej Properties is launching three signature towers as part of Godrej Urban Park, which it said is strategically located 5 minutes from Powai and 16 minutes from WEH, EEH. Homes here offer elevated lifestyle with 30+ amenities across three lifestyle annexes, said Godrej Properties, adding that customers booking now can avail launch offer: pay 10% now and rest at OC*.

345.title: Kuldeep hasn't been dropped, he has been released due to bubble fatigue: Bumrah
345.article_body: Team India vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah has clarified that Kuldeep Yadav has not been dropped from Test squad for the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka but has been released due to bubble fatigue. Bumrah said, "He has been in bubble for a long time. Staying in a bubble is not easy. The mental aspect is important," Bumrah added.

346.title: Ukraine has lost all communications with Chernobyl: UN nuclear watchdog
