346.article_body: Ukraine has lost all communications with the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said on Thursday. This came a day after the Russian-controlled site lost external power supplies. IAEA Director General Rafael Mariano Grossi said the agency is aware of reports that power has been restored to the site and is looking for confirmation.

347.title: BJP shouldn't suffer from indigestion from poll victory: Shiv Sena
347.article_body: Shiv Sena on Friday said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' that "BJP shouldn't suffer from indigestion" from its election victory as it's "more difficult to digest victory than defeat". BJP is set to form governments in four states that went to polls. The poll results' impact on Maharashtra will be like "monkeys getting hold of a bottle of liquor", it added.

348.title: $117 billion wiped off Tesla rival Rivian's market cap in 4 months
348.article_body: US-based electric vehicle startup Rivian has lost about $117 billion in market value in just four months. Rivian's market valuation had topped $153 billion a few weeks after its initial public offer (IPO), but the company's valuation now stands at about $36 billion. Rivian briefly became the second most valuable automaker in the US after billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla.

349.title: Haryana govt planning to hold Surajkund Mela twice a year
349.article_body: Haryana government is planning to hold the Surajkund Mela twice a year, Faridabad's district administration officials said. The authorities are planning to hold the fair, which aims to promote craftsmanship, before the onset of the winter season in November as well. The 35th edition of the fair will be held from March 19-April 4 after a gap of two years.

350.title: 'Musk & I have broken up again,' says Grimes after secretly welcoming 2nd child together
350.article_body: Singer-songwriter Grimes, who revealed to Vanity Fair that she and Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed their second child via surrogacy in December, shared that they've broken up. "Me and E have broken up *again* since the writing of this article...but he's my best friend and the love of my life," she tweeted. They have named their daughter Exa Dark Sideræl.

351.title: Rihanna planning IPO for her lingerie company at $3 billion valuation: Report
351.article_body: Singer Rihanna is reportedly working with advisers on taking her lingerie company Savage X Fenty public, which could value her lingerie company at $3 billion or more. The report claims that the listing could happen this year but the company hasn’t made any official decision yet. Savage X Fenty was launched in 2018 as an online-only brand.

352.title: Indians to explain what caused this: Pak as it claims Indian missile landed on its soil
352.article_body: After claiming that an unarmed Indian supersonic missile landed at a place 124 km within Pakistani territory, Pakistani Major General Babar Iftikhar said, "Whatever caused this incident to happen, it's for the Indians to explain." He added that Pakistan "strongly protests" this and "cautions against recurrence of any such incident in future". India is yet to respond to Pakistan's allegations.

353.title: EU will not sanction Russian gas or oil: Hungary PM Orban
353.article_body: The European Union will not impose sanctions on Russian gas or oil, Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said in a Facebook post on Friday. "So, Hungary's energy supply is secure in the upcoming period," Orban added. Most of Hungary's oil and natural gas imports come from Russia. His comments came as EU leaders gathered in France to discuss the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

354.title: Maha sanctions ₹131 cr to modernise Pune's Yerawada mental hospital
354.article_body: Maharashtra government has sanctioned ₹131 crore for the modernisation and upgradation of Pune's Yerawada regional mental hospital, believed to be one of the largest mental hospitals in Asia. "The old buildings in the campus belong to the British era and have grown old and dilapidated," the facility's superintendent said. An order granting permission for the project was issued on Wednesday.

355.title: Aadhaar card helps reunite disabled K'tata man with mother after 6 yrs
355.article_body: 19-year-old Bharat with hearing impairment, who was found at Nagpur Railway Station in 2016, reunited with his mother in Karnataka on Wednesday. Back then he was sent to an orphanage. When the orphanage's counsellor applied for Bharat's Aadhaar card, his biological details were found to be linked with another Aadhaar card registered in 2012, using which they reached his mother.

356.title: Police seize 240 gm of heroin in Assam, one arrested
356.article_body: A 26-year-old drug peddler was arrested by police in Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Thursday after they seized 240 grams of heroin from his possession. Police said they had carried out an operation in front of Hotel Dream Sky under Khatkhati Police station near the Bokajan area. They recovered the drug from 19 soapboxes from the accused.

357.title: Kerala earmarks ₹10 crore for studies of students evacuated from Ukraine
357.article_body: Presenting the Kerala Budget for 2022-23 on Friday, state Finance Minister KN Balagopal said ₹10 crore has been earmarked to help the students, who returned to the state in wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, to continue their studies. Balagopal added that 3,123 people have returned safely to the state through various flights, including 15 chartered flights, amid the crisis.

358.title: Deeply concerned over laws targeting LGBTQ+ in US : Apple CEO
358.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook has expressed his concerns over US laws targeting the LGBTQ+ community amid controversy on a US bill that prohibits classroom discussion of sexual orientation and gender identity for many young students. "As a proud member of...LGBTQ+ community, I am deeply concerned about laws being enacted across the country," Cook said. Florida lawmakers passed the bill earlier.

359.title: UP is just a tableau, Maharashtra is yet to come: Fadnavis
359.article_body: A day after the BJP won a majority in three states in the Assembly polls, ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis said that "now the fight will be in Mumbai", referring to the upcoming municipal polls. "We won't be against any party, we'll be against bribery & corruption...Uttar Pradesh is just a tableau, Maharashtra is yet to come," the BJP leader added.

360.title: Naxal commander carrying ₹3 lakh reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
360.article_body: A Naxal commander, carrying a reward of ₹3 lakh on his head, was killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Friday, an official said. According to police, the encounter took place near Mosla where an armed group opened fire on the patrolling team. A jawan of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) was injured in the operation, police added.

361.title: Samajwadi Party leader attempts self-immolation after party's defeat in UP polls
361.article_body: The Vice President of Samajwadi Party's (SP) Kanpur unit, Narendra Singh alias Pintu, allegedly attempted suicide by setting himself on fire outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Lucknow on Thursday, police said. The incident took place after SP lost the Uttar Pradesh election to the BJP. Singh has suffered 30% burn injuries and is stated to be in a critical condition.

362.title: Canada restaurant changes signature dish's name from 'The Vladimir' to 'The Volodymyr'
362.article_body: A Canadian restaurant chain that makes a local delicacy of fries topped with gravy and cheese curds has changed the name of its signature dish following customer complaints after Russia's war with Ukraine. Frite Alors! used to call the dish "The Vladimir" after the Russian President. The dish is now called "The Volodymyr" in honour of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

363.title: UNSC to discuss US, Ukraine biowarfare labs at Russia's request
363.article_body: The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) will meet on Friday to discuss Russia's claims about alleged US "military biological activities" in Ukraine. Russia's request for the UNSC meet came after the US rejected Moscow's accusations that the US was operating biological warfare labs in Ukraine and suggested Russia may be laying the groundwork to use a chemical or biological weapon.

364.title: Delhi University teachers to hold protests over multiple issues
364.article_body: The Delhi University Teachers' Association (DUTA) will conduct a series of protests over multiple issues including the merger of the College of Art with Ambedkar University and the absorption of ad-hoc teachers. According to DUTA President AK Bhagi, the association will conduct a dharna on March 22 followed by college-wise demonstrations in multiple phases on March 25, 28 and 29.

365.title: Russian missile strikes house in Ukraine killing 11 of 12 family members, pics surface
365.article_body: A Russian missile hit a house in Ukraine's Marhalivka, killing 11 of the 12 family members. Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared pictures of the man and his cat who survived the strike. The ministry revealed that the man and his family had left Kyiv to be safe. The man lost his wife, daughter, mother-in-law, sister, sons-in-law, grandchildren and nieces.

366.title: Couldn't process what was happening: Deepika recalls her 1st meeting with SRK
366.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who made her Bollywood debut in 2007 with Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Om Shanti Om', revealed that she was "almost in a daze" when she first met the actor. Calling him "India's biggest superstar", she said, "I remember just sitting at the edge of...sofa, being so nervous, and almost in a daze. I couldn't even process what was happening."

367.title: B'luru metro train flagged off with Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav images
367.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) Managing Director Anjum Parwez has flagged off a metro train wrapped with Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav graphics in Bengaluru. A video of the event shows people waving green flags as the train begins its trip. Earlier, a study showed that metro trains have significantly contributed to the reduction of carbon emission in the city.

368.title: Destroy high-threat pathogens in labs as they may be bombed: WHO to Ukraine
368.article_body: The WHO has asked Ukraine to destroy high-threat pathogens in labs to prevent "any potential spills" as the facilities may be bombed amid Russia's attack. Biosecurity experts have said that Russia's movement of troops into Ukraine and bombardment of its cities have raised the risk of an escape of disease-causing pathogens.

369.title: Delhi Police personnel who violate traffic rules could be fined double
369.article_body: Delhi Additional CP Traffic Ajay Krishan Sharma issued an order warning the police personnel that a double penalty will be imposed against them if found violating traffic rules. This comes after there were numerous complaints on social media against traffic rule violations by Delhi Police personnel. He has also instructed traffic police to prosecute police officers who violate traffic rules.

370.title: Lava flows as Indonesia's Mount Merapi continues to erupt
370.article_body: Indonesia's most active volcano Mount Merapi on Java island continued to erupt on Friday, forcing local authorities to halt tourism and mining activities on the slopes of the volcano. The volcano began unleashing clouds of hot ash and lava before midnight on Wednesday. Mount Merapi's last major eruption was in 2010, in which more than 345 people were killed.

371.title: Masaba says she gets roles of 'girl with acne or with troubled childhood'
371.article_body: Masaba Gupta, when asked about the kind of roles she was offered earlier in her career, said, "No roles were coming my way." "Even today, whatever is coming is very like 'somebody who'd troubled childhood, or acne'," she said, adding, "I don't think I ever get a role that's...focus of a man's life [or] where I can be romanced."

372.title: Every player except Jadeja will still be kicking themselves: Russel
372.article_body: Discussing Team India's first Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said every Indian player barring Ravindra Jadeja will still be "kicking themselves". "Even Rishabh Pant [who scored 96 runs in the first innings of the opening Test]," added Russel. "Pathum Nissanka is struggling, that's a big blow [for Sri Lanka]," stated Russel.

373.title: PM Modi assures support to AAP in Punjab, Kejriwal says 'Thank you, sir'
373.article_body: Hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Twitter for its victory in Punjab Assembly elections, AAP chief and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "Thank you, sir." "I assure all possible support from the Centre for Punjab's welfare," the Prime Minister had written on Twitter on Thursday.

374.title: PM holds roadshow in Gujarat after BJP returns to power in 4 states
374.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday held a roadshow in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after BJP won Assembly elections in UP, Uttarakhand and Manipur, and became the single largest party in Goa. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and state BJP president CR Paatil were accompanying PM Modi. PM will address Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan which will be attended by over one lakh Panchayati Raj representatives.

375.title: I will be editing photos during quarantine: PBKS coach Anil Kumble
375.article_body: Discussing his plans for the three days of "hard quarantine" before Punjab Kings' (PBKS) training for IPL 2022 begins, PBKS coach Anil Kumble who is passionate about photography said he will be "editing" his photos. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26 with defending champions CSK taking on IPL 2021 runners-up KKR in the first match.

376.title: Govt invites applications from drone industry for ₹120 cr PLI scheme
376.article_body: The government has invited applications for the production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme for drones and drone components. Last year, the Cabinet had cleared a PLI scheme worth ₹120 crore for drone industry. Under the scheme, the incentive for a manufacturer of drones and drone components will be 20% of the "value addition" made by the company during the next three years.

377.title: Maha Traffic Police collects e-challan dues worth ₹57.15 cr in a month
377.article_body: The Maharashtra Highway Police collected e-challan dues worth ₹57.15 crore from 11.60 lakh motorists in a month's time. This comes after the police issued pre-litigation notices to the defaulters asking them to be present before the court on March 12 for non-payment of e-challans. The Highway Traffic Police had started this exercise of serving pre-litigation notices to motorists in 2021.

378.title: Pune policeman arrested for forging service record to apply for President's medal
378.article_body: A havaldar attached to Pune City Police's special branch has been arrested for allegedly forging his service record while submitting the application for the President's Police Medal for meritorious service. Along with the policeman, three others, including two clerks and the policeman's aide, who was the daybook in-charge at Wanwadi police station in 2019, were booked for cheating and forgery.

379.title: Punjab CM Channi submits resignation to Governor after defeat in polls
379.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi on Friday submitted his resignation to Governor Banwarilal Purohit after Congress' defeat in the Assembly elections. Congress won 18 seats in the polls, with Channi losing from both Chamkaur Sahib and Bhadaur. Congress' Punjab chief Navjot Singh also lost from the Amritsar East seat.

380.title: Miss Bikini Universe India 2018 and Congress' Archana gets 1,519 votes in UP polls
380.article_body: Miss Bikini Universe India 2018 and Congress candidate from Uttar Pradesh's Hastinapur, Archana Gautam, got only 1,519 votes in the Assembly elections. BJP candidate Dinesh won from Hastinapur with 1,07,587 votes, while SP candidate Yogesh Verma received 1,00,275 votes. Gautam thanked the people who voted for her.

381.title: Russian forces attack Kharkiv institute housing nuclear reactor: Ukraine
381.article_body: Ukraine has accused Russia of "nuclear terrorism" after Russian forces shelled an institute in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv, which houses a nuclear reactor. The shelling caused a fire in a neighbouring hostel, which has now been put out. Russian forces have already taken over two nuclear power plants in Ukraine, raising concerns about the security of the nuclear facilities.

382.title: Ian Healy criticised for 'Not surprised' comment on Shane Warne's demise
382.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Ian Healy has been criticised for his remark on Shane Warne's demise wherein he said that Shane's "early passing" didn't surprise him as he "didn't look after his body". "Healy, pull your head in. The time to make a claim that you were 'right' here is ill-timed," a fan said. "How disgraceful of Healy!" wrote another.

383.title: Online registration for Amarnath yatra to begin from April
383.article_body: Shri Amarnath Shrine Board (SASB) will begin online registrations for Amarnath yatra from April, the board confirmed on Thursday. "The online registration will start through banks in the month of April 2022 with a limit of 20,000 registrations fixed per day," SASB official said. The pilgrims can also make on-spot registration at designated counters during yatra days, he added.

384.title: SC to hear plea against Ashish Mishra's bail on March 15 in Lakhimpur case
384.article_body: Supreme Court said that it will hear a plea challenging the bail granted to Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Mishra Teni's son, Ashish Mishra on March 15. He is the prime accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. Ashish was arrested in October 2021 after at least four farmers and a journalist were killed in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri.

385.title: No global firm can touch Russia's blood money, thank you Mastercard: Ukraine Vice PM
385.article_body: Days after Mastercard suspended its operations in Russia, Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said, "I'm sure...no global company can touch Russia's blood money as long as its tanks and missiles kill Ukrainians." "Thank you, Mastercard, for the first steps towards peace, but have you terminated all financial contracts with Russia?" he wrote on Twitter.

386.title: India becomes world's 5th most-valued stock market, beats UK: Report
386.article_body: India has become the fifth most-valued stock market, beating the UK, Canada and Saudi Arabia, Moneycontrol reported. The Indian market has lost around $257.35 billion since the start of 2022 amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine and its value is currently above $3 trillion. The US stock market, which is world's most-valued at $47.32 trillion, has lost $6.6 trillion this year.

387.title: Saheb's clever attempt: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on PM's 2024 remark
387.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi said that 2022 UP election results have decided 2024 Lok Sabha results, political strategist Prashant Kishor tweeted, "Battle for India will be fought and decided in 2024 & not in any state elections." "Saheb knows this! Hence this clever attempt to create frenzy around state results to establish a decisive psychological advantage over opposition," he wrote.

388.title: New IT park, 4 IT corridors, 20 satellite IT hubs proposed in Kerala Budget
388.article_body: Kerala Finance Minister KN Balagopal, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 in Assembly on Friday, proposed to set up a new IT park, four IT corridors and 20 satellite IT hubs. Balagopal added that ₹100 crore has been set aside for the expansion of the IT parks and ₹1,000 crore has been earmarked for land acquisition in the sector.

389.title: Police lathi-charge SP-RLD supporters after they pelt stones in UP
389.article_body: Police lathi-charged SP-RLD supporters in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat on Thursday after they tried to forcefully enter a vote counting centre and pelted stones at police officers. Three police officers and six SP-RLD supporters were injured. The SP-RLD supporters had allegedly been angered after the BJP candidate defeated the SP candidate from the Baraut seat with a margin of 315 votes.

390.title: Crypto brain drain is crazy in India: Dubai-based Polygon Co-founder
390.article_body: Dubai-based blockchain platform Polygon Co-founder Sandeep Nailwal while discussing India's cryptocurrency sector and its regulations said, "The brain drain is absolutely crazy." He discussed how developers, investors and entrepreneurs are leaving for places with more friendly regulation. He said he wishes to stay in India and promote the Web3 ecosystem but regulatory uncertainty is a hurdle.

391.title: Kerala HC allows 10-year-old rape survivor to terminate pregnancy
391.article_body: The Kerala High Court allowed medical termination of the 30-week-old pregnancy of a 10-year-old rape survivor. A medical board constituted to examine the victim, had said that an operative delivery was needed and there is an 80% chance of the baby surviving. "The court should invoke the jurisdiction, in this case, keeping in mind the Almighty," the bench said.

392.title: Biopic on Indian spy Ravindra Kaushik starring Salman shelved: Reports
392.article_body: A biopic on Indian spy Ravindra Kaushik, who was known as Black Tiger, has reportedly been shelved. Salman Khan had announced the project last year. According to reports, filmmaker Raj Kumar Gupta had the rights for five years which have now expired. The reports also mentioned that the 'Ek Tha Tiger' actor was also apprehensive about playing another spy.

393.title: It needs to be second nature: Karthik on Pant's 'technical flaw'
393.article_body: Dinesh Karthik termed Rishabh Pant's inability to get his hands in the right position previously as a "technical flaw", adding that it needs to be "second nature" because of the lack of time. "He has worked on that. It takes...time to settle in," stated Karthik. "Repetition is very important..., the amount of work he has put in...is reflecting," said Karthik.

394.title: Railway operations disrupted after crude bomb found on tracks in Bihar
394.article_body: Railway operations were disrupted for at least two hours after a crude bomb was found on the railway tracks near Guraru railway station in Bihar's Gaya district, according to police. The bomb was found within 100 metres of the railway station, Gaya ASP Manish Kumar said. The explosive was defused by the bomb squad on the tracks.

395.title: UP elections result a lesson, should learn from it: BSP chief Mayawati
395.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati said that the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections result is a lesson. "We should not be discouraged by it. Instead, we should learn from it, introspect...carry forward our party movement, and come back to power," she added. "Negative campaigns succeeded in misleading...that BSP is BJP's B-team...while the truth is opposite," Mayawati further said.

396.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest 3 for possessing, selling drugs
396.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Thursday arrested three people for possessing drugs and seized four hash oil bottles weighing 20 ml. According to Lallaguda SHO Madhulatha, the accused were apprehended in Lalapet where they were trying to sell the drugs to needy customers. Police also seized three mobile phones used in the commission of the offence.

397.title: How did the top 3 richest candidates perform in Punjab Assembly elections?
397.article_body: AAP's Kulwant Singh, richest candidate in Punjab Assembly elections with over ₹238-crore assets, won SAS Nagar seat by beating Congress' Balbir Singh Sidhu by 34,097 votes. SAD leader and ex-Deputy CM Sukhbir Singh Badal, second-richest candidate with ₹202-crore assets, lost from Jalalabad to AAP's Jagdeep Kamboj by 30,930 votes. Congress' Karan Kaur, third-richest candidate, lost from Muktsar.

398.title: Untrained people won't be sent to frontlines: Ukraine Defence Min
398.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said that more than 1,00,000 Ukrainians have joined the country's territorial defence unit. However, he added that untrained civilians taking up arms against Russia won't be sent into frontline battles. "It doesn't make any sense...Being outnumbered, our army is still stopping enemy forces because it's motivated, better trained and armed," Reznikov said.

399.title: All artists are equal: Big B as a fan compares him to other actors
399.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan responded to a fan who praised his performance in the recently released film 'Jhund' and tweeted, "A man in 80 delivers a new level Cinema...much better than 30-60 heroes giving nowadays." The fan added that 'Jhund' is a "clean family film with a concrete message". "Humbled and embarrassed by...comparison. All artists are equal...please don't give comparisons," Amitabh wrote.

400.title: How did the top 3 richest candidates perform in UP Assembly elections?
400.article_body: Congress' Nawab Kazim Ali Khan, the richest candidate with over ₹296-crore assets, lost from Rampur seat after receiving 4,000 votes. AIMIM's Shah Alam, the second-richest candidate with assets over ₹195 crore, lost from Mubarakpur after receiving fourth-highest votes (36,460). SP's Supriya Aron, the third-richest candidate with assets over ₹157 crore, lost from Bareilly Cantt by 10,768 votes.

401.title: Social media users criticise Ola for its '8 missed calls from mom' notification
401.article_body: Social media users have criticised Ola after it sent a notification that read '8 missed calls from mom'. Ola sent the notification to promote 40% discount on certain services. "Why is Ola traumatising me like this?" a user asked, while another user wrote, "Ola, are you trying to give me a heart attack?"
